intro: Danais bakeriana, commonly known as the Baker's danais, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the island of St. Helena. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family, characterized by its small, delicate flowers and evergreen foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in areas with high humidity and mild temperatures. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, and it produces small, round fruits that contain seeds. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, Danais bakeriana is considered vulnerable and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
